qas.question: What is the name of the military base in New York City?
In what year was Fort Hamilton founded?
In what borough is Fort Hamilton located?
What division is based at Fort Hamilton?
What brigade is headquartered at Fort Hamilton?
The U.S. military has only one active location in NYC named what?
Which borough can Fort Hamilton be found?
Fort Wadsworth and Fort Totten are located in which area of New York City?

context: New York City is home to <a0_0><a5_0>Fort Hamilton<a5_0/><a0_0/>, the U.S. military's only active duty installation within the city. Established in <a1_0><a6_0>1825<a6_0/><a1_0/> in <a2_0><a7_0>Brooklyn<a7_0/><a2_0/> on the site of a small battery utilized during the American Revolution, it is one of America's longest serving military forts. Today Fort Hamilton serves as the headquarters of the <a3_0>North Atlantic Division<a3_0/> of the United States Army Corps of Engineers as well as for the New York City Recruiting Battalion. It also houses the <a4_0>1179th Transportation Brigade<a4_0/>, the 722nd Aeromedical Staging Squadron, and a military entrance processing station. Other formerly active military reservations still utilized for National Guard and military training or reserve operations in the city include Fort Wadsworth in Staten Island and Fort Totten in <a8_0>Queens<a8_0/>.
